Metadata: Bastadin 20 and bastadin O-sulfate esters from "Ianthella basta": novel odulators of the Ry1R FKBP12 receptor complex

The bastadins are a family of highly modified tetrapeptides occuring in the marine sponges "Ianthella" spp. and "Psammaplysilla purpurea". Bastadins 1-7 exhibit moderate antibacterial activity, while other bastadins have been shown to have in vitro cytotoxic activity against human tumor cell lines or antiinflammatorâ€‹y activity. This paper reports the isolation of two new analogues from "I. basta" and two novel sulfate half-esters.
